title: Drawing, Portrait of a Singer, probably Faustina Bordoni, before 1720
title_raw: Portrait of a Singer, probably Faustina Bordoni
medium: pastel on paper mounted on canvas
provenance:
Laurence Currie, Coombe Warren, Kingston Hill, Surrey [1]; Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum















[1] Sold London, Christie's, December 17th, 1926 [Lot 134] for 168BP, the lot of four pastels [1960-1-7-a,b,c,d]
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description: Bust length portrait of a woman in the act of singing. She holds a music book in her right hand. She wears pendant pearl earrings as well as jewels and flowers in her hair. Her head is inclined slightly to the left and her face is turned half-right.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Portrait of a Singer, probably Faustina Bordoni, before 1720;  Rosalba Carriera (Italian, 1675 - 1757); Italy; pastel on paper mounted on canvas; 45.3 x 35 cm (17 13/16 x 13 3/4 in.); Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960-1-7-a
